title: What is the Net Asset Value per Unit NAVPU of a Fund in GFunds
content:

- [What are the steps to get a Fully Verified GCash account?](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/360017722393-What-are-the-steps-to-get-a-Fully-Verified-GCash-account)
- [Accepted IDs for GCash Verification](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/900000948786-Accepted-IDs-for-GCash-Verification)
- [How do I send money to another GCash account?](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/360017566614-How-do-I-send-money-to-another-GCash-account)

The **Net Asset Value Per Unit (NAVPU)** tells you the **price per unit** of a fund. This value **may increase or decrease daily,** depending on how well the fundâ€™s investments are doing in the market.

NAVPU is computed by dividing the **fund's overall value by the total number of units the fund has.**

**Sample Calculation** Suppose a fund has a total net value of PHP 50 million and has 5 million units. The NAVPU would be:

**![unnamed (3).png](https://help.gcash.com/hc/article_attachments/41088632575001)**

If the value of the fund increases to PHP 55 million the next day, the NAVPU will rise to **PHP 11.00**.
